critique: This document is an executive order defining vital military and naval installations and equipment requiring protection against the general dissemination of information. It is based on existing statutes (18 U.S.C. 795 and 797). The order itself doesn't express a clear ideological tilt. It focuses on national security by restricting access to information about military installations and equipment. It expands executive power by giving the President and Secretaries of Defense, Army, Navy, and Air Force the authority to classify information. It centralizes control at the federal level. It prioritizes national security over civil liberties by restricting the dissemination of information. It does not directly address economic regulation or social inclusion. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:
